messages.title: OLIVER BATTLES FOR OUR LOCAL CHALK RIVERS
messages.content: Oliver works closely with local river campaigners and is a supporter of the national campaign to protect our precious English chalk rivers from growing pollution, over-abstraction of water and habitat destruction. He is calling on Government to draw up a plan to save the rivers and their unique habitat for fish, creatures and rare plants. Oliver recently held a House of Commons' debate where he highlighted the condition of our 7 local chalk rivers and brought the Environment Minister to visit the Beane and the Mimram. Oliver’s cross-party campaign at Westminster is gaining support.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Oliver advocates for the protection of local chalk rivers, supporting a national campaign to save them from pollution, over-abstraction, and habitat destruction. He has called on the government to create a plan to protect these rivers and their unique habitats.

issues.environment: Supports the national campaign to protect English chalk rivers from pollution and habitat destruction, and has brought attention to their condition through a House of Commons' debate.

contactInformation.address: 75 Station Rd, Letchworth Garden City, Herts, SG6 3BJ

images.caption: Oliver beside the River Beane near Stapleford

leaflet.additionalNotes: The campaign for chalk river protection appears to be cross-party and received attention in the House of Commons.
